snippet: A nonpartisan review concluded that the use of torture had “damaged the standing” of the United States and “potentially increased the danger to U.S. military personnel.”
abstract: Nonpartisan, independent review of interrogation and detention programs after Sept 11, 2001, terrorist attacks concludes that United States engaged in torture and that nation’s highest officials were responsible; study says that while brutality has occurred in every American war, detainee treatment after 9/11 was unprecedented and damaged country's standing.
lead_paragraph: A nonpartisan review concluded that the use of torture had “damaged the standing” of the United States and “potentially increased the danger to U.S. military personnel.”

headline.seo: U.S. Practiced Torture After 9/11, Nonpartisan Review Concludes
headline.main: U.S. Engaged in Torture After 9/11, Review Concludes
headline.print_headline: U.S. Practiced Torture After 9/11, Nonpartisan Review Concludes

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
